Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

 

Title: ‚ÄúThe beginning‚Äù  

 

Text: ‚ÄúHello! I come with an idea for Minecraft, which would be a new dimension called "The Beginning" This new dimension would be very similar to the end, and if, if I'm talking about the sky, in this dimension would be found all kinds of animals that would run out as you approached and there would be a big, majestic red dragon that would be flying all over the place, it would be harmless unless you stole their treasure that would be hidden in a mountain , by defeating him this would become harmless and we could assemble it and try to tame it by giving it cod. This would serve to give Minecraft a little more lore, and you could see in achievements: When going to this dimension there would be an achievement that would say "The Home? And by defeating the dragon we would get the achievement "The Beginning of the End" by implying that this would have bad consequences.‚Äù 

- Translated by Admin

Title: Grimstone greyer, as in the trailer

Text: In the trailer for minecon 2020, we saw a much more stical grimstone. It combines much more with the caves. I understand you want to give it a bedrock-like look. But that's not why she has to be ugly like her.

-Translated by Admin
This is a realy good idea, but i want automatics farms in minecraft bedrock

(cont.)

  The Veil is an occasion to -- literally -- rise to; it is a dimension of conquest sporting sprawling dungeons and structures to explore and loot while fighting powerful foes. Some Dungeons sport certain Conduit-like objects which will give the player (or even its monsters) a continuous effect while in range. Some will give players a "falling" debuff which will keep them from flying freely while inside the structure. Such objects can be procured by players who wish to use them to buff mobs or debuff players/mobs, or build bases in the Veil that have gravity (or bases underwater which make players and mobs sink like a rock).

  One reward could be a special kind of object that would give players an effect that allows them to place normal blocks in the Veil while in range.

  The Veil share a daynight cycle with the overworld.

 (cont.)

New blocks include:

  • Lingering Cloud- A block which entities (except gravity blocks) can pass through, but liquids cannot. Requires Silk Touch Shovel to mine. Generates as secluded clouds, and below terrain as if to prop it up. Puts out entities on fire.
  • Lingering Storm- Cloud block that causes rain effect below it. Created by water-logging a Lingering Cloud by force. Rarely generates.
  • Azurestone- A sky-blue stone that sounds like crystal when stepped on. Changes color with the sky (darkens at night).
  • Azurestone brick variants. Do not change color, but come in Light-blue (Day Bricks), Orange (Sunset Bricks), and Navy-Blue (Night Bricks).
  • Ethereal Trees- Ethereal wood and planks, and Ethereal Leaves. The leaves are off-white, and glow softly in the dark. The wood itself is unusually soft, and grey in color with black bark.
  • Good Soil- A kind of dirt block which, when tilled, will grow crops effectively without being watered (including plants that normally need water, such as sugarcane). Has a grass block equivalent.
+Lingering Snowstorm- Made by using a bucket of powdered snow on a Lingering Cloud. Like the Lingering Storm, but causes snow instead of rain.

You have a wonderful imagination, but as far as good gameplay is concerned, this idea is extremely poorly thought through. Just a few issues I can see:

1) Your ideas about leather armor burning up, gold armor taking extra damage, and taking extra damage without a full suit of armor in this dimension are all totally unprecedented, and it isn't clear why this kind of behavior would be worth adding. (It also isn't super clear how they work.)

2) The emerald pickaxe is not a good idea. Mojang probably wouldn't want anything in the game that can break bedrock. Emerald is also easier to find than diamond if you find a village, which makes for some weird progression.

3) The main goal of your dimension, finding Firestone ore, is totally worthless because of the Fire Protection armor enchantment and the Fire Aspect weapon enchantment... not to mention a good old Fire Resistance potion.

I like the idea, so let's try to expand on it, adding more detail. 

What mobs will spawn in this biome? Well, I think there should be brown and black bears, bats, and maybe otters. As well as sea lions. 

For ores, maybe coal, iron, and quartz. Quartz would spawn rarely, but it'd be a way to obtain it without travelling to the nether. Clay could also be found, and maybe a new ore/mineral, Marble. Marble would be similar to quartz, it'd look nice in some decorations.

As for structures, I have no ideas.

This biome may even probably go hand in hand with the 'Cliffs' aspect of the upcoming Java/Bedrock Edition 1.17 Caves & Cliffs update. Not only will the Fjord biome feature sheer cliffs and deep blue green water, it might also be a good way to mix both the 'Caves' & 'Cliffs' aspect of the update:
‚Ä¢ it might add strategy to mining ores by having the ores spawn in different levels on the Fjord's cliffsides;
‚Ä¢ perhaps this biome could benefit from the upcoming feature called 'Local Water Levels' which might make the waterfalls possible.
‚Ä¢ this may become one of the places where goats can spawn naturally

The Fjord biome would prove to be challenging to traverse, as the sheer cliffsides can only be easily traversed by goats, and the player might have to use boats to travels throught it.
Overall, the Fjord biome would serve to be a balanced mixture between the 'Caves' & 'Cliffs' aspects of the 1.17 update.

I love this idea! This could add a lot to the ‚ÄúCliffs‚Äù part of the Caves and Cliffs update! I have a few suggestions that I think would go well with this. With fjords, there could be a chance for taiga trees to spawn on gentle slopes, with other parts having sheer drop offs, providing a little risk to exploring the biome. There could be small waterfalls streaming down the sides, and a rare chance for glaciers to generate at the beginning point of the fjord. If it‚Äôs possible, the can be a rare snowy variant of the biome, with a frozen over river. If the fjord opens up to an ocean, there could be a chance for a village to generate there. As for structures, there could be stone tower ruins, and possibly Viking style villages and/or taiga villages, and for mobs, seagulls would make a great addition.

Another idea, if the Fjord opens up to a ocean, it should change the shipwreck generation in the area. They would be viking style with spruce as a wood majority.

And, goats should spawn with different fur colors or whatever it is

Okay, so there are some problems to address here.

1) The problem with making a "secret recipe" mechanic is that, once a few people have found out about it, the recipe will be up on the wiki and it will no longer be a secret. That just about completely defeats the entire purpose of your dimension.

2) You haven't done a good job of convincing me that the enlargement and pee-wee potions are something we need to have in the game. They don't seem to serve any useful purpose, really.

3) There's no mention of how we would find the boss mob.

4) There's no discussion of what the terrain would look like for your new dimension.

Answers:

1) That's happened in other games, like Halo 4. The glimpse of Master Chiefs face was supposed to be for people who beat the game on legendary difficulty. So, I don't care.

2) They're super cool.

3) It would grow from the ground in front of tye player once he/she has travelled 298 blocks.

4) It would be like the overworld but with more hills and the whole dimension would be in negative colors.

That's not going to be enough to earn my vote, sorry. For me, "super cool" is just not a good enough reason to add something into the game. Thank you for the other answers, though, and thanks for posting.
Maybe instead of "super cool" it could be used to (a get higher objects and (b get into tiny places
